body:
The expiry date of your caution is based on:

* the information you’ve provided 
* the current law on when cautions and convictions expire

This table shows the information you provided, which was used to work out the expiry date. If you entered any incorrect information, the expiry date will be incorrect.

 | | |
|---|---|
| Criminal record type | **Caution**|
| Type of Caution | **Conditional** |
| Age at time of caution | **Under 18** |
| Date caution given | **17 December 2018**|
| Conditions ended | **17 March 2019** |
| Conditions stuck to | **Yes** |

___

components.html: If you need to change any information, or if you have another caution or conviction you’d like to check, [use the service again](/).

heading: Your {disposal_type, select, cautioned{caution} convicted{conviction} other{NOT SET}} expired on 17 March 2019
lede: You do not need to tell anyone about this caution unless an [exception applies](https://www.gov.uk/exoffenders-and-employment?#when-employers-still-need-to-know-about-your-conviction).
